intro: Phalacroseris, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their spiny, leaf-like bracts that surround the flower heads, giving them a distinctive appearance. They are typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Phalacroseris species often have small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Their botanical features make them an important component of coastal ecosystems and a subject of interest in horticulture.
